column1: The edifice known as the Pantheon
column3: is one of the best preserved specimens of Roman architecture. It was erected in the year 26 B.C.
column4: and is therefore now about one thousand nine hundred years old. It was consecrated as a Christian church in the year 608. Its rotunda is 143 ft. in diameter and also 143 ft. high. Its portico is remarkable for the elegance and number of its Corinthian columns.Señor Felipe Poey
column6: has recently brought out an exhaustive work upon the fishes of Cuban waters
column7: in which he describes and depicts no fewer than 782 distinct varieties
column8: although he admits some doubts about 105 kinds
column9: concerning which he has yet to get more exact information. There can be no question
